(53).COPY NO.IRST DRAFT.A B I N E T.DRAFT OF THE KING'S SPEECH ON THE OPENING OF PARLIAMENT, NOVEMBER 21st, ,1955.DISARMAMENT PARAGRAPH.The following has been drafted by the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs for insertion in The King's Speech on the Opening of Parliament, the B^rst Draft. . - : - ,.of which was circulated on November 10th, 1933.(See Paper CP. 266 (33))."The central purpose of My Government in inter-national affairs is to promote and to sustain, by every means in their power, peace in the world. With this object in view, My Government will continue to co-operate with other Governments in endeavouring to reach a satisfactory solution of the complicated questions of disarmament under discussion between them in order to achieve a settlement acceptable to all. My Government remain determined to uphold the work of international co-operation by collective action through the machinery of the League of Nations and in all other ways calculated to further not only good relations but good feeling and neighbourliness between all states and peoples."(Signed) M.P.A. HANKEY,Secretary to the Cabinet.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.I., 11th November, 1935.
